item.title: 1 - Blockchain Foundation
item.description: Consensys developer program academy.consensys.net/developer History of blockchain 1990s Stuart Haber / Scott Stornetta How to keep the past data secure and keep digital information safe and resistant to tampering 1991 - First paper outlined the use of a chain of cryptographically secured blocks to preserve the integrity of past information and protect it. 1993 - Spam countermeasures 2008 - Bitcoin is born Satoshi Nakamoto Released whitepaper: “Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electornic Cash System” 2014 - Ethereum

item.title: 2 - Blockchain - The Technical Side
item.description:
Public an private keys are large integer numbers and they are represented using a separate Wallet Import Format (WIF), consisting of letters and numbers.
Private key is used to generate a signature for each blockchain transaction a user sends out. It is used to confirm that the transaction has come from the user and also prevents the transaction from being altered by anyone once it has been issued. You sign the cryptocurrencies you send to others using a private key.
